sources.data_found:
Weill Cornell Medicine Scientific Computing Unit (SCU) 'Eureka' Cluster Specifications: 
- 'gpu-a100' partition: 1 node w/ 8x A100 (80GB).
- 'gpu-v100' partition: 2 nodes w/ 4x V100 (32GB) each.
- 'gpu-k80' partition: 1 node w/ 4x K80 (legacy).
Additional Weill Cornell Hardware details: Mentions 'Rosalind' cluster (older) and updates to Eureka. Confirms A100 and V100 presence.

student_data.notes: Student counts estimated from Cornell Institutional Research and Bowers College of Computing & Information Science (CIS) data. Undergrad: Based on reports of 'over 2,000 affiliated CS majors' (Arts & Sciences + Engineering), estimated at 2,100. Grad (MS): Estimated ~750 based on ~500 degrees awarded annually. PhD: Estimated ~320 based on ~50-60 annual degrees.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Estimated from CAC Red Cloud 'g4' instance availability (cloud pool).
Legacy node on Weill Cornell Eureka cluster.

gpu_resources.notes: GPU Totals aggregate Ithaca campus (CAC Red Cloud) and Weill Cornell Medicine (SCU Eureka). A100 80GB: 8 (Weill) + ~16 estimated (CAC Red Cloud). V100: 8 (Weill) + ~32 estimated (CAC Red Cloud). Cornell uses a cloud model making exact inventory opaque; counts are conservative estimates based on instance availability.

compute_credits.description: Cornell uses a subscription/fee-based model for Red Cloud (CAC) rather than free compute credits.

analysis_notes: Ensemble result aggregated from OpenAI, Claude, and Gemini models.
